text: my name is Mark I'm head of public
sector for the Republic of Ireland at
Amazon web services and I'm coming up on
four years here at AWS my role is
supporting public sector customers to
leverage AWS services to better meet
citizens needs I have a team of account
managers but also work with partner
managers capturing proposal teams
marketing Etc to ensure that we we fully
support the Irish Market to adopt cloud
services
for me the most exciting part is getting
to build that team out and so it's a
still a relatively new team or a young
team from an AWS perspective so we're
coming up on two and a half years old
and we were previously part of the UK
and Ireland business and split out in at

build that team from from scratches is
really exciting
there is a really strong focus on
well-being within the business now and
as there is within society and so many
businesses if in general AWS does take
it seriously we are concerned about the
mental health and well-being of our of
our of our staff and our team members
for me personally it's about getting a
balance of getting some activity in my
day getting to spend time talking to my
team so that I'm not engaging with a
laptop screen that I'm also now that
we're back meeting people again face to
face that I'm getting some some personal
time and then when I do switch off I
switch off so I'm you know I tend not to
be I'm I'm not in a Seattle reporting
line so I'm lucky from that perspective
and but at six o'clock I tend to I tend
to stop I get off the get off the mails
get off the
um chime groups the slack groups and
give myself that down time in the
evening so that I'm I'm fresh when I
come into it again the next day why is
diversity important for AWS and
employees just two main reasons for me
why it's important first of all we serve
a very diverse customer base and a very
diverse community
so we need a diverse range of opinions
within the business to help us
effectively and serve those customers
and secondly the workplace environment
itself you know we need to understand
what the diverse needs of our of our
employees are so the more people that we
have in from different backgrounds and
have different ways of thinking the
better a workplace environment that we
can create and to ensure that we're
attracting more diversity in the future
and so for me it's those two critical
elements of ensuring that we're meeting
our customers needs in a diverse way and
also supporting our employees
effectively
